clusters.title: Fallece a los 79 años Diane Keaton, actriz de “Annie Hall” y “El Padrino”
clusters.neutral_headline: Diane Keaton, Oscar-winning actress, dies at age 79

items.title: Fallece a los 79 años Diane Keaton, actriz de “Annie Hall” y “El Padrino”
Oscar-winner actress Diane Keaton dies aged 79
items.standfirst: Diane Keaton, the Oscar-winning star of “Annie Hall,” “The Godfather” films and “Father of the Bride,” whose quirky, vibrant manner and depth made her one of the most singular actors of a generation, has died. She was 79.People Magazine reported Saturday that she died in California with loved ones, citing a family spokesperson.
items.content: Diane Keaton, the Oscar-winning star of “Annie Hall,” “The Godfather” films and “Father of the Bride,” whose quirky, vibrant manner and depth made her one of the most singular actors of a generation, has died. She was 79.People Magazine reported Saturday that she died in California with loved ones, citing a family spokesperson.

items.title: Hollywood's quirky leading lady, Diane Keaton, dies aged 79
items.standfirst: Diane Keaton, who remained one of Hollywood's quirkiest and most beloved actors decades after her Academy Award-winning performance in the movie Annie Hall, has died aged 79.
items.content: Diane Keaton, who remained one of Hollywood's quirkiest and most beloved actors decades after her Academy Award-winning performance in the movie Annie Hall, has died aged 79.(Image credit: Chris Pizzello)

items.title: Academy Award-winning actress Diane Keaton dies aged 79

items.content: She was best known for roles in films including in The Father of the Bride, The Godfather and Annie Hall.

items.title: Diane Keaton, star of "Annie Hall" and "Father of the Bride," dies at 79

items.content: Diane Keaton had a decades-long career with performances in 1977's "Annie Hall," the "The Godfather" films, and many more.

items.title: Diane Keaton, Oscar-winning star of 'Annie Hall' and 'The Godfather,' dies at 79

items.content: The actor, known for her quirky, vibrant manner and depth was 79. Across her decades-long career, she worked with prominent filmmakers including Francis Ford Coppola, Woody Allen and Nancy Meyers.(Image credit: Chris Pizzello/Invision)

items.standfirst: Keaton was best known for her roles in Annie Hall, Reds and The Godfather films.
items.content: Keaton was best known for her roles in Annie Hall, Reds and The Godfather films.

items.title: Academy Award-winning actress Diane Keaton dies at 79
items.standfirst: US actress Diane Keaton, known for her Oscar-winning performance in 1977's "Annie Hall" and her role in "The Godfather" films, has died at age 79, People magazine reported Saturday.
items.content: US actress Diane Keaton, known for her Oscar-winning performance in 1977's "Annie Hall" and her role in "The Godfather" films, has died at age 79, People magazine reported Saturday.

ai_summary: Diane Keaton, known for "Annie Hall" and "The Godfather," has died at 79.
Keaton's career spanned decades, working with prominent filmmakers like Woody Allen.
She was recognized for her quirky and vibrant acting style.
Keaton won an Academy Award for her performance in "Annie Hall" in 1977.
Reports indicate she passed away in California with loved ones present.

items.title: Preparations begin to ramp up aid in Gaza as ceasefire brings hope for end to 2-year war
items.standfirst: Preparations were also underway Sunday for the release of Israeli hostages held in Gaza and Palestinian prisoners held in Israel.
items.content: Preparations were also underway Sunday for the release of Israeli hostages held in Gaza and Palestinian prisoners held in Israel.(Image credit: Mohammed Arafat)

items.title: Gaza ceasefire holds but key issues remain unresolved ahead of peace summit
items.standfirst: Hamas will begin releasing Israeli hostages held in Gaza on Monday morning as part of the first phase of a peace deal pushed by US President Donald Trump that will also see the release of nearly 2,000 Palestinian prisoners. But many issues remain unresolved as Trump and his Egyptian counterpart Abdel Fattah al-Sisi prepare to chair a summit of more than 20 countries in the Red Sea resort of Sharm el-Sheikh.
items.content: Hamas will begin releasing Israeli hostages held in Gaza on Monday morning as part of the first phase of a peace deal pushed by US President Donald Trump that will also see the release of nearly 2,000 Palestinian prisoners. But many issues remain unresolved as Trump and his Egyptian counterpart Abdel Fattah al-Sisi prepare to chair a summit of more than 20 countries in the Red Sea resort of Sharm el-Sheikh.

items.title: Pakistan, Afghanistan Trade Heavy Fire as Clashes Turn Deadly
Pakistan closes Afghan border as Kabul claims it killed 58 soldiers in overnight clashes
items.standfirst: Pakistan closed all border crossings with Afghanistan on Sunday after deadly overnight clashes in which Afghan forces claimed to have killed 58 Pakistani soldiers. Islamabad regularly accuses the Taliban administration in Kabul of harbouring militants who attack Pakistan, a charge Afghan officials deny.

items.title: Watch: Tennessee town comes together to confront tragedy
items.standfirst: Authorities have confirmed that 16 people were killed when an explosives plant in rural Tennessee exploded on Friday morning.
items.content: Authorities have confirmed that 16 people were killed when an explosives plant in rural Tennessee exploded on Friday morning.

items.title: 16 people died in a blast at a Tennessee explosives factory early Friday, sheriff says
items.standfirst: A blast in rural Tennessee that leveled an explosives plant and was felt for miles around killed 16 people and left no survivors, authorities said.
items.content: A blast in rural Tennessee that leveled an explosives plant and was felt for miles around killed 16 people and left no survivors, authorities said.(Image credit: Obed Lamy)

items.title: 10/11: Saturday Morning

items.title: No survivors after blast at Tennessee military explosives plant, sheriff says
items.standfirst: Humphreys County Sheriff Chris Davis confirmed 16 victims in the blast at a news conference on Saturday night.
items.content: Humphreys County Sheriff Chris Davis confirmed 16 victims in the blast at a news conference on Saturday night.

items.title: No survivors in Tennessee plant explosion, sheriff says
items.standfirst: It is unclear how many people were inside the Tennessee plant that exploded on Friday, but at least 16 people were reported on Saturday. Sheriff Chris Davis announced that there are no survivors. Nicole Valdes reports.
items.content: It is unclear how many people were inside the Tennessee plant that exploded on Friday, but at least 16 people were reported on Saturday. Sheriff Chris Davis announced that there are no survivors. Nicole Valdes reports.

items.title: No survivors found after Tennessee explosives plant blast
items.standfirst: With 16 people unaccounted for, the tragedy is "even more devastating than we thought", says a sheriff.
items.content: With 16 people unaccounted for, the tragedy is "even more devastating than we thought", says a sheriff.

items.title: At least 16 killed in blast at Tennessee explosives plant
items.standfirst: Officials say victims' families have been notified and that the cause of the blast is still not known.
items.content: Officials say victims' families have been notified and that the cause of the blast is still not known.

items.title: Sheriff says Tennessee explosives factory blast left no survivors
items.standfirst: A blast on Friday at the rural Tennessee Accurate Energetic Systems plant, which supplies and researches explosives for the military, left no survivors, authorities said, adding that the 16 people inside the building are presumed to be deceased.
items.content: A blast on Friday at the rural Tennessee Accurate Energetic Systems plant, which supplies and researches explosives for the military, left no survivors, authorities said, adding that the 16 people inside the building are presumed to be deceased.

ai_summary: An explosion at a Tennessee explosives plant killed 16 people.
Authorities confirmed there were no survivors of the blast.
The blast occurred at the Accurate Energetic Systems plant.
The plant supplied and researched explosives for the military.
Families of the victims have been notified of the tragedy.

items.content: The president's directive would ensure US military personnel don't miss a scheduled paycheque next week.

items.title: Trump directs Pentagon to use "all available funds" to pay troops amid shutdown
items.standfirst: The government shutdown entered its 11th day Saturday as Republicans and Democrats remain at an impasse over a spending plan, and the Trump administration began laying off thousands of federal workers.
items.content: The government shutdown entered its 11th day Saturday as Republicans and Democrats remain at an impasse over a spending plan, and the Trump administration began laying off thousands of federal workers.

items.title: Trump directs Pentagon to use 'available funds' to pay military during shutdown
items.standfirst: President Trump's announcement comes days before active duty members would have missed their first full paycheck as the shutdown of the federal government continues.
items.content: President Trump's announcement comes days before active duty members would have missed their first full paycheck as the shutdown of the federal government continues. (Image credit: Andrew Harnik)

items.title: Trump says military members will be paid despite government shutdown
items.standfirst: President claims he found a way to pay troops and directed Pentagon chief to release funds on 15 OctoberDonald Trump claimed on Saturday that he had found a way to pay US military troops despite the ongoing federal government shutdown, saying he had instructed his defence secretary, Pete Hegseth, to release funds.Posting on his Truth Social platform, Trump wrote: “I am using my authority, as commander-in-chief, to direct our secretary of war, Pete Hegseth, to use all available funds to get our troops PAID on October 15.” Continue reading...
items.content: President claims he found a way to pay troops and directed Pentagon chief to release funds on 15 OctoberDonald Trump claimed on Saturday that he had found a way to pay US military troops despite the ongoing federal government shutdown, saying he had instructed his defence secretary, Pete Hegseth, to release funds.Posting on his Truth Social platform, Trump wrote: “I am using my authority, as commander-in-chief, to direct our secretary of war, Pete Hegseth, to use all available funds to get our troops PAID on October 15.” Continue reading...

items.title: Trump lays off thousands of US government workers amid govt shutdown
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump on Friday blamed Democrats for his decision to lay off thousands of workers across the US government as he followed through on his threat to cut the federal workforce during the government shutdown.
items.content: President Donald Trump on Friday blamed Democrats for his decision to lay off thousands of workers across the US government as he followed through on his threat to cut the federal workforce during the government shutdown.

ai_summary: Trump directed the Pentagon to use funds to pay military personnel.
The government shutdown entered its eleventh day.
The announcement came days before troops would miss paychecks.
Trump is using his authority as commander-in-chief.
Thousands of federal workers are being laid off.

items.content: An army unit claimed it had taken over leadership of the military command and was now in control of all the armed forces.

items.title: Madagascar Presidency Says Attempt to Seize Power Underway
Madagascar army unit claims control as president alleges power-grab
items.standfirst: Elite troops join youth-led protests over utilities that have swelled into gravest threat for President Andry Rajoelina.
items.content: Elite troops join youth-led protests over utilities that have swelled into gravest threat for President Andry Rajoelina.

items.title: Madagascar leader says power grab under way as army unit claims control of military
items.standfirst: Madagascar's President Andry Rajoelina said in a statement on Sunday that "an attempt to seize power illegally and by force" was underway in the Indian Ocean island state, a day after some soldiers joined a vast protest movement that started last month. The mutinied army unit announced it was taking control of all military forces in the country.
items.content: Madagascar's President Andry Rajoelina said in a statement on Sunday that "an attempt to seize power illegally and by force" was underway in the Indian Ocean island state, a day after some soldiers joined a vast protest movement that started last month. The mutinied army unit announced it was taking control of all military forces in the country.

ai_summary: The Madagascar presidency reports an attempt to seize power.
An army unit claims control of the military.
Protests have been ongoing in the country.
The president alleges an illegal power grab.
The army unit joined the protest movement.

items.title: Cameroon votes in presidential election as Paul Biya, 92, seeks eighth term
items.standfirst: Biya, the world’s oldest serving head of state, is likely to extend his 43 years in power in Central African nation.
items.content: Biya, the world’s oldest serving head of state, is likely to extend his 43 years in power in Central African nation.

items.title: Cameroon heads to the polls with world's oldest leader Biya seeking eighth term
items.standfirst: Polls opened in Cameroon on Sunday in an election that could see Africa’s oldest leader Paul Biya, aged 92, extend his 43-year rule by another 7 years. Biya faces nine opposition candidates, including some former allies and appointees.
items.content: Polls opened in Cameroon on Sunday in an election that could see Africa’s oldest leader Paul Biya, aged 92, extend his 43-year rule by another 7 years. Biya faces nine opposition candidates, including some former allies and appointees.

items.title: Cameroon’s 92-year-old president set for another term as country goes to polls
items.standfirst: Paul Biya, in power since 1982, has brushed off calls to retire but is rarely seen in publicCameroon goes to the polls on Sunday for a presidential election with Paul Biya, already the world’s oldest head of state at the age of 92, the favourite to win an eighth term in power in the central African country.A fractured opposition of 11 candidates is standing against Biya, who, despite his advanced age and declining health, has dismissed calls for him to retire. Continue reading...
items.content: Paul Biya, in power since 1982, has brushed off calls to retire but is rarely seen in publicCameroon goes to the polls on Sunday for a presidential election with Paul Biya, already the world’s oldest head of state at the age of 92, the favourite to win an eighth term in power in the central African country.A fractured opposition of 11 candidates is standing against Biya, who, despite his advanced age and declining health, has dismissed calls for him to retire. Continue reading...

items.title: Can the world's oldest president keep his title and woo a nation of young voters?
items.standfirst: Cameroon's Paul Biya promises young voters "the best is yet to come" as others hunger for "young blood".
items.content: Cameroon's Paul Biya promises young voters "the best is yet to come" as others hunger for "young blood".

ai_summary: Cameroon held presidential elections.
Paul Biya, the world's oldest leader, seeks an eighth term.
Biya has been in power since 1982.
He faces nine opposition candidates.
The opposition is fractured.

items.content: Youth-led demonstrators enter Antananarivo's May 13 Square for the first time since protests erupted last month.

items.title: Soldiers from elite Capsat unit join protests against Madagascar’s president
items.standfirst: Demonstrators march alongside regiment, who earlier in the day said they would not fire on the crowdsMadagascar’s prime minister called for calm after an elite group of soldiers joined thousands of protesters against the country’s president on the streets of the capital on Saturday afternoon.Protesters marched alongside soldiers from the Capsat unit, who drove armoured vehicles, some waving Madagascar flags, from their base in Soanierana in the south of Antananarivo. Continue reading...
items.content: Demonstrators march alongside regiment, who earlier in the day said they would not fire on the crowdsMadagascar’s prime minister called for calm after an elite group of soldiers joined thousands of protesters against the country’s president on the streets of the capital on Saturday afternoon.Protesters marched alongside soldiers from the Capsat unit, who drove armoured vehicles, some waving Madagascar flags, from their base in Soanierana in the south of Antananarivo. items.title: Madagascar soldiers join protestors, refuse orders to shoot demonstrators
items.standfirst: Groups of Madagascar soldiers joined youth-led protests in the capital of Antananarivo on Saturday after police used stun grenades and tear gas. The soldiers, who said that they would refuse any orders to shoot demonstrators, arrived at the heart of the gathering near the Lake Anosy area where they were welcomed with cheers.
items.content: Groups of Madagascar soldiers joined youth-led protests in the capital of Antananarivo on Saturday after police used stun grenades and tear gas. The soldiers, who said that they would refuse any orders to shoot demonstrators, arrived at the heart of the gathering near the Lake Anosy area where they were welcomed with cheers.

items.title: More than 500,000 Palestinians return to ruined Gaza City as truce holds
items.standfirst: More than half a million displaced Palestinians have returned to Gaza City since a ceasefire came into effect Friday, Gaza's civil defence agency said on Saturday. Many displaced Palestinians returning home were left stunned by the destruction while others were amazed to find their homes still standing.

Many displaced Palestinians returning home were left stunned by the destruction while others were amazed to find their homes still standing.

items.title: ‘It’s complete devastation’: Gazans return home to ruins

items.content: Displaced civilians returned to a landscape of rubble and ruins in Khan Younis as the Gaza ceasefire came into effect. “No signs of life are left,” said one man. “Everything has been wiped out.”
